body.p: During its redeliberation of the exposure draft ED 9 Joint Arrangements, the Board reconsidered the scope exception of IAS 31 that had also been proposed in ED 9. The Board concluded that the scope exception in ED 9 for interests in joint ventures held by venture capital organisations, or mutual funds, unit trusts and similar entities, including investment-linked insurance funds, that are measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9 Financial Instruments is more appropriately characterised as a measurement exemption, and not as a scope exception.
